fi.grimripper.loww.templates

Class HexAndNeighborsTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.templates.HexAndNeighborsTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MovementTemplate, ObstacleTemplate

    public class HexAndNeighborsTemplate
extends java.lang.Object
implements MovementTemplate
    A template that includes a hex and all its neighbors, except remote neighbors. It would be suitable for both hexes and squares, except that size and movement indices differ. In this class, they are implemented for hexes, along with the tile getter. The template is symmetric in both horizontal and vertical directions.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen

    • Method Detail

      • isHorizontallySymmetric

        public boolean isHorizontallySymmetric()
        Description copied from interface: ObstacleTemplate
        Checks if the template is horizontally symmetric. A horizontally symmetric template will cover the same tiles for the same main tile regardless of whether facing is to the east or to the west. A horizontally asymmetric template needs either east or west facing, and can't have a vertical facing.
        Specified by:
        isHorizontallySymmetric in interface ObstacleTemplate
        Returns:
        template is horizontally symmetric

      • isVerticallySymmetric

        public boolean isVerticallySymmetric()
        Description copied from interface: ObstacleTemplate
        Checks if the template is vertically symmetric. A vertically symmetric template will cover the same tiles for the same main tile regardless of whether facing is to the north or to the south. A vertically asymmetric template needs either north or south facing, and can't have a horizontal facing.
        Specified by:
        isVerticallySymmetric in interface ObstacleTemplate
        Returns:
        template is vertically symmetric

      • getTiles

        public Tile[] getTiles(Tile mainTile,
              Direction facing)
        Description copied from interface: ObstacleTemplate
        Gets the tiles this template includes. The tile array must be the same size and have tiles with similar positions in the same indices regardless of location and facing. Therefore must include nulls if the template is partially outside the tile grid. The templates should always be tested to be within the bounds, to avoid obstacles being placed partially outside the tile grid.
        Specified by:
        getTiles in interface ObstacleTemplate
        Parameters:
        mainTile - location where the template is placed
        facing - facing direction that determines the template's position
        Returns:
        tiles included in the template, with given location and facing

      • turnInPlace

        public Tile turnInPlace(Tile mainTile,
               Direction oldFacing,
               Direction newFacing)
        Description copied from interface: ObstacleTemplate
        Gets new main tile when the template is turned. After the turn, the template should cover the same tiles as before. An asymmetric template's main tile may need to be moved so that it'll continue to occupy the same tiles. For symmetric templates, this method is unnecessary, and they can simply return the location.
        Specified by:
        turnInPlace in interface ObstacleTemplate
        Parameters:
        mainTile - the template's main tile, prior to turning
        oldFacing - the direction which the template was facing before turning
        newFacing - the direction which the template faces after turning
        Returns:
        new main tile after turning

        Parameters:

        facing - host's facing in the location
        Returns:
        template's center point in the specified position

      • getMoveIndices

        public int[] getMoveIndices(Direction to)
        Description copied from interface: MovementTemplate
        Gets indices of entered tiles when a mobile object moves. After a step, the tiles in the given indices are ones that were not included in the template before the step. This method assumes that the mobile object is moving to the direction it's facing, so asymmetric templates don't have extra requirements.
        Specified by:
        getMoveIndices in interface MovementTemplate
        Parameters:
        to - step direction
        Returns:
        indices for new tiles
